text: The Tun Abdul Ghafar Baba Memorial is a museum in Peringgit, Malacca, Malaysia, dedicated to Abdul Ghafar Baba, who was Deputy Prime Minister from 1986 to 1993 under Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad and Chief Minister of Malacca from 1959 to 1967. The building, originally his residence, was turned into a museum and opened on 28 February 2006. It has two exhibition halls: the lower hall shows his personal items from his time as Chief Minister and Deputy Prime Minister, while the upper hall displays souvenirs, photos, books, and furniture used by him and his family. ==References== Category:2006 establishments in Asia Category:21st-century establishments in Malaysia Category:Museums in Malaysia Category:Malacca
